title: 113_s2676
content: The Act may be cited as the "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2014" and includes a grant program regarding firearms. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2014" includes a grant program where the Director of the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services can provide grants to eligible States to support the implementation of specific policies, procedures, and laws related to law enforcement and the courts. An eligible State seeking a grant under the "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2014" must submit an application to the Director of the Office of Community Oriented Policing Services, containing relevant information as required. The State's policies, procedures, protocols, laws, or regulations must relate to firearms or ammunition possession or transfer, imposing restrictions and penalties similar to or more comprehensive than specified sections. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2014" requires the seizure of firearms and ammunition from individuals convicted of specified crimes or against whom a protection order has been issued. State and local courts must consider the possession of firearms or ammunition by individuals arrested for relevant crimes. The "Domestic Violence Gun Homicide Prevention Act of 2014" allows State and local law enforcement to seize firearms and ammunition from individuals involved in domestic violence situations if there is probable cause to believe the weapons pose a threat. The Act allows for the seizure of firearms and ammunition from individuals involved in domestic violence situations if there is a threat, and provides for the safe return of the seized items once certain conditions are met. The Act allows for the safe return of seized firearms and ammunition if they are determined not to be contraband or illegally in the suspected offender's possession, in a manner that does not endanger the safety of victims or persons protected by a protection order. Authorization of appropriations is provided for the implementation of this section.
